result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:41 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas J. Bevan appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing in court for the defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Re:  Possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver, second and subsequent offense, on 05-26-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess methamphetamine, possess methamphetamine waste, possess methamphetamine with intent to deliver and knowingly solicit the purchase of pseudophedrine.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-31-22 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $20,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with Anthony Carter, DOB: 03-15-1990, Sarah Gunn, DOB: 04-23-1993 and the premises at 1031 S. 16th Street, Manitowoc and defendant is not to possess any products used to make methamphetamine including psuedoephedrine.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
